channel.title: How to make a webclient [fix 'error click for details']
channel.description:
[center][b][i][size=36pt]arya's webclient tuturial (fixing 'click for details') [/size][/i][/b][/center]
[b]so i know people have problems with making webclient and the error click for details NOW in this tuturial i wil show you how to make a webclient without the error[/b] [i]it's very easy just folow the instructions and everything wil be okay [/i]
[b]let's begin[/b]
1) so you need a - source and client (if you don't have one click here for downloading:[url=http://uppit.com/e8ech8ct8oye/PDF_Source_and_Client_Package!.rar]http://uppit.com/e8ech8ct8oye/PDF_Source_and_Client_Package!.rar[/url] [img]http://i45.tinypic.com/2rgjq5i.jpg[/img]
so when you've change the ip and coded (server name etc.) you've to jar and sign
- open up jarmaker if you don't have one just download it [url=http://goldenstudios.or.id/products/utilities/jarmaker/JARMaker.zip]http://goldenstudios.or.id/products/utilities/jarmaker/JARMaker.zip[/url] - choose youre destkop for output directory - change [i]demorpg.jar[/i] to [i]webclient.jar[/i] - now for input directory choose youre client/bin folder - now press manifest template ->main class: client - then 'create JAR! [img]http://i47.tinypic.com/t9v7mu.jpg[/img]
[b]now sign it[/b] (if you're 64bit choose program files (x86) - for jarsigner location go to c://program files/java/jdk1.x.0_xx/bin/jarsigner.exe - now generate a keystore file press generate keystore... -> keytool location go to C:\program files\java\jdk1.x.0_xx\keytool.exe -> output keystore file choose you're destkop and name it certificate -> keystore your name -> public key/private key a password (do it same it's easyer) -> the other things are not matter (ignore them) (see the picture) [img]http://i50.tinypic.com/25p4ldd.jpg[/img]
- keystore file press it and ok it wil be automatic certificate - keystore alias your name - public key/private key the password that you've entered in generate keystore - sign JAR! [img]http://i49.tinypic.com/iw6f09.jpg[/img]
- so you've made a jar file! gratz! - now uploading and hosting then you're ready you can use many hosting webstites
- you can choose between ->x10hosting ->wix.com ->yola ->webs.com [b]important don't upload your webclient.jar to the hosting sites upload it to dropbox it's better[/b]
i use wix.xom sign up and create a website insert a html widget then just paste this code
<HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE>[b]server name[/b]</TITLE> <META HTTP-EQUIV="PRAGMA" CONTENT="NO-CACHE"> </HEAD>
<BODY>
<applet name="[b]server webclient name[/b]" width="100%" height="100%" archive="[b]dropbox download link to webclient.jar[/b]" code="client.class"> <param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx1024m"> </applet>
</BODY> </HTML> ____________________________________________________________________________
so paste it and save/publish and done!
[img]http://i50.tinypic.com/4s022p.jpg[/img]
for porject dungeonfest cache fix got to clientsettings change the cache link to this https://dl.dropbox.com/u/92668072/rspsCache2.zip
so i hope i've helped if you've any questions you can always ask me (and if it's possible please rep++)
thank you ;)

item.dc:creator: @ggson ggson

item.title: How to make a webclient [fix 'error click for details']
item.dc:creator: @ggson ggson
item.description:
@ggson wrote:

What do you mean the ‘path’ of where the client.class file is? How are we ment to find its path when it is inside a ‘.jar’ file??!?!?! can you show us some pics or a more detailed explanation please? :D[quote=“makersprivate123, post:25, topic:450320”]For those who get the error with client class, just get the location of where the client.class and change the red text to the path of it.

server name [/quote]
